p.span: The information on this page may help all of us avoid catching or spreading the Coronavirus COVID-19. Additionally, you may benefit from information about homeschooling that will occur over the next few weeks.
Please note the helpful information and resources posted on the left.

div.class: tatsu-row-wrap tatsu-wrap tatsu-row-has-one-half tatsu-row-has-two-cols tatsu-medium-gutter tatsu-reg-cols tatsu-clearfix tatsu-rklu1oqR48

span.strong: 3/18/2020: In conjunction with the Borough of Haddonfields announced state of emergency, the Board of Education has closed all school playgrounds and fields indefinitely as we continue to support efforts to slow the spread of the Coronavirus.

div.class: tatsu-column tatsu-column-no-bg tatsu-one-half tatsu-column-image-none tatsu-column-effect-none tatsu-HJx6giq0N8

p.strong: This is an update of Dr. Mussolines Message to Families,

span.strong: sent via email at about 9:00 a.m. on Monday, March 23, 2020.

div.p: On Saturday, March 21, New Jerseys Governor Murphy announced a statewide stay at home order as of 9:00 p.m. that evening. On Wednesday, April 15th , he stated that New Jersey schools would remain closed at least until May 15th. Here in Haddonfield, we will continue to provide the highest level of remote instruction possible, moving forward in compliance with Gov. Murphys latest directive.

strong.u: In direct response to the Governors message, we share the following important information with Haddonfield parents.

ul.li: A stay-at-home lifestyle and remote instruction are likely to continue for an indefinite period of time. We should plan to follow his directive until further notice.
Beginning Monday, March 23rd, all school district buildings will rermain closed with these three exceptions:

div.p: o Haddonfield students who want a free bag lunch may still come to the Chestnut Street entrance (the flagpole doors) of the Haddonfield Middle School between 11 a.m. and noon, Monday and Thursday.

o Our technology team will be responding through email and phone to requests for assistance Monday thru Friday from 7:00 a.m. through 5:00 p.m. We will make every effort to assist any student technical issue remotely. If a face-to-face meeting is required, an appointment can be set. See details for contact information below.*
o The Board of Education building, closest to the Central school playground and PATCO tracks, will be manned with a skeleton staff from 9:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. Monday through Friday.

ul.li: As previously stated, as long as we are engaged in remote instruction, all athletics and extracurriculars are cancelled.

Although we are working from home, we are committed to supporting you and our students. Teachers, EAs, principals, technology staff, counselors, nurses and others are available when you need assistance.

div.p: o Your teachers have shared their office hours with you.
o Our principals are a great resource for information.

o To reach our technology department*, please email them at [emailprotected]. Provide your phone number in case a conversation is required. Someone will reply between 7:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Monday through Friday. If a face-to-face meeting is required, they will make those arrangements.
o Please help us to communicate effectively. Check texts, voicemail, and email regularly. If you use social media, follow your schools accounts and the districts:

Twitter: @HaddonSchools
Facebook: @HaddonfieldSchoolDistrict

p.strong: Finally, remember that we are all in this together.

div.p: Perhaps better than any other school district in the area, our community has reacted quickly and enthusiastically to the complexities of remote teaching and learning. With only one official day of training, Haddonfield teachers have converted their daily instruction to a virtual format. Parents responded to the crisis by creating at-home learning spaces, following daily schedules, and actively supporting their younger students. At every level and in every department, we have consistently risen to challenges we never expected to face.

In fact, during our first weeks of remote instruction, many different members of the Haddonfield community and our district staff have commented on the positive messages, photos and videos shared on social media. We have posted morning meetings, dance competitions, jokes of the day, principal challenges, our physical set-ups for homeschooling, completed projects, theme days, faculty meetings, daily schedules, and so much more. We have shared ideas for academic lessons, enrichment activities, physical exercise and organizational plans. Individuals have held free online Zumba classes and art lessons. We have been working together to help one another and to remain connected, albeit virtually.
Good job to all. Lets keep this going! We are in this together.
If you have supportive photos or messages for our school community, please post on Twitter, using our hashtag #HSDWeAreInThisTogether.
We will update you regularly. Stay home and stay safe!
Sincerely,

Larry Mussoline, Ph.D.
Superintendent of Schools

div.div: Copyright Haddonfield Board of Education document.write(new Date().getFullYear());. All Rights Reserved
Web Design by Sagapixel SEO | Web Design | PPC

div.p: In compliance with Governor Murphy's most recent directive of April 16, 2020, Haddonfield School District buildings will be closed "through at least Friday, May 15" except for certain hours for faculty and family support and for the distribution of bag lunches.
Spring Break will take place as planned, from Friday, April 10 through and including Friday, April 17. Remote teaching and learning will resume Monday, April 20, 2020.
To view the next meeting of the Board of Education to be held Thursday, April 23 at 7:00 p.m., click here. There will be onscreen instructions about how to call in with questions or comments.
During these weeks of remote education, please make use of our district's FAQ sheet, and feel free to contact your child's teacher or principal with questions or concerns.
Thank you. Stay safe and stay home.
